Question: Why, when attaining the fruits of learning,
is view the uninterrupted path,
and view the path of liberation?
When attaining the fruits of no-learning,
is view the uninterrupted path, and cognition the path of liberation?
Answer: In the state of the fruits of no-learning, all that should be done is already accomplished.
The preparatory effort ceases and is no longer sought.
Therefore it is not called view.
The fruits of learning are not like this, so they are called view.
Question: Why is cognition first mentioned and view later mentioned in the state of no-learning, while both view and cognition are mentioned first and last in the state of learning?
Answer: In the state of no-learning, one necessarily first gives rise to the cognition of exhaustion.
Therefore cognition is first mentioned.
Later, when one gives rise to superior meritorious qualities,
there is also discernment, so view is mentioned last.
In the state of learning, one first gives rise to the receptivity to the cognition of the factors of the truth of suffering.
It is only view, not cognition, so view is mentioned first.
Later, the uncontaminated cognition has not yet accomplished what it needs to do.
It continues to investigate and understand, and is also called seeing.
